item.title: TikTokのクリエイター5人のグループが、2024年1月1日からアプリを禁止するモンタナ州の法律を覆すため、修正第1条などを理由に提訴（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
A group of five TikTok creators sue to overturn Montana's law that is set to ban the app starting January 1, 2024, citing the First Amendment and more  —  A spokeswoman for the state attorney general said that his office had “expected a legal challenge” and was “fully prepared to defend the law.”

item.title: 情報筋の話：Disneyは5月26日にDisney+とHuluの数十の番組のパージを開始、同社は前回の決算説明会で$1.5B-$1.8Bの減損を発表（Nellie Andreeva/Deadline)
item.description:
Nellie Andreeva / Deadline:
Sources: Disney will start purging dozens of Disney+ and Hulu shows on May 26; the company announced a $1.5B-$1.8B impairment charge at its last earnings call  —  Disney is starting to pull content from streaming, with dozens of series and specials slated to leave Disney+ and Hulu on May 26, Deadline has learned.

item.title: Twitter、Blue契約者の動画アップロード制限を1時間・2GBから2時間・8GBに引き上げ、ただし最大解像度は1080pのまま（Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Ivan Mehta / TechCrunch:
Twitter increases its video upload limits for Blue subscribers from one hour and 2GB to two hours and 8GB, but the maximum resolution remains at 1080p  —  Twitter has made changes to its paid plan, allowing subscribers to upload two-hour-long videos — expanding the previous 60-minute limit.

item.title: ビッグテックに報道機関への支払いを求めるのは間違ったアプローチだ。彼らの運命は連動するようになり、ニュースへの投資の増加は保証されない、など（Cory Doctorow/Pluralistic)
item.description:
Cory Doctorow / Pluralistic:
Requiring Big Tech to pay news outlets is the wrong approach, as their destinies will become linked, an increase in news investment isn't guaranteed, and more  —  It's no longer controversial to claim that Big Tech is a parasite on the news business.  But there's still a raging controversy …

item.title: チュニジアの控訴裁判所は、テロ対策作戦の詳細を公表した後、情報源を明らかにすることを拒否したジャーナリストに対し、5年の禁固刑を宣告した（AP通信社）
item.description:
Associated Press:
A Tunisian appeals court sentences a journalist to five years in prison for refusing to reveal his sources after publishing counterterrorism operation details  —  A Tunisian appeals court has sentenced a journalist to five years in prison for revealing details of a counterterrorism operation …

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズは、2022年1月から実験を行い、記者がどのように仕事をしたのか、より多くの情報を提供する「強化された傍線」をオンラインで開始した（Hanaa' Tameez/Nieman Lab.）
item.description:
Hanaa' Tameez / Nieman Lab:
The New York Times launches “enhanced bylines” online to offer more information on how reporters did their work, after running the experiment since January 2022  —  “This is a way to modernize how we do what we do,” Lee said.  “It's more colloquial, it's more plain-spoken.”

item.title: ディズニーがオーランドのオフィスコンプレックスを建設し、2000人以上の従業員をカリフォルニアからフロリダに移す計画をキャンセル、情報源：デサンティスの確執が決定に影響（Brooks Barnes/New York Times）
item.description:
Brooks Barnes / New York Times:
Disney cancels plans to build an Orlando office complex and move 2,000+ workers from California to Florida; sources: the DeSantis feud influenced the decision  —  A new office complex, and relocation of a division from California, would have created more than 2,000 jobs but was scuttled …

item.title: Netflixの株価は、ストリーマーが2022年11月初旬に導入した広告付きプランの世界月間アクティブユーザー数が5M近くになったと報告した後、10%以上跳ね上がる（Todd Spangler/Variety)
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Netflix shares jump 10%+ after the streamer reported it has almost 5M global monthly active users for its ad-supported plan introduced in early November 2022  —  Shares of Netflix jumped more than 10% Thursday on news that the streamer had signed up almost 5 million customers …

item.title: ディズニー、ネットフリックス、コムキャスト、アップル、WBD、パラマウント、フォックス、アマゾン、メタ、アルファベットのCEO給与とその前年比推移を、レイオフをしながら見ていく（バラエティ）
item.description:
Variety:
A look at CEO salaries and their year-over-year changes at Disney, Netflix, Comcast, Apple, WBD, Paramount, Fox, Amazon, Meta, and Alphabet, as they do layoffs  —  Economists are fretting about a recession.  Media stocks are in the toilet.  Layoffs are being enacted monthly as a spirit of cut …

item.title: Institute for Nonprofit Newsエグゼクティブディレクター兼CEOのスー・クロスが2023年末までに退任予定、クロスは2015年9月にINNに入社（Institute for Nonprofit News）
item.description:
Institute for Nonprofit News:
Institute for Nonprofit News executive director and CEO Sue Cross plans to step down by the end of 2023; Cross joined INN in September 2015  —  Veteran journalist and news leader Sue Cross will step down as executive director & CEO of the Institute for Nonprofit News (INN) by the end of this year, INN announced today.

item.title: ソースはこちらJoe Bidenは、ベテランの政府弁護士Anna GomezをFCCに指名する意向で、上院が彼女を承認すれば、2年以上にわたる党派間の行き詰まりを打破できる（Todd Shields/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Todd Shields / Bloomberg:
Source: Joe Biden intends to pick veteran government lawyer Anna Gomez for the FCC, breaking a more than two-year partisan deadlock if the Senate confirms her  —  President Joe Biden intends to select veteran government lawyer Anna Gomez to serve on the Federal Communications Commission …

item.title: トリビューン社を83億ドルでレバレッジ・バイアウトし、4,200人の解雇と破産を招いた不動産億万長者サム・ゼル氏、81歳で死去 (Patrick Oster/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Patrick Oster / Bloomberg:
Real estate billionaire Sam Zell, whose $8.3B leveraged buyout of Tribune Co. led to layoffs of 4,200 people and bankruptcy, dies at 81  —  Sam Zell, the billionaire investor who called himself “the Grave Dancer” for his bets on distressed assets, including a losing wager that drove the Tribune Co. into bankruptcy, has died.

item.title: アンディ・ウォーホル財団対ゴールドスミス事件で、1981年に撮影した写真をプリンスの作品に使用したウォーホルが著作権を侵害したとする写真家側の主張をSCOTUSが支持した（Dan Mangan/CNBC)
item.description:
Dan Mangan / CNBC:
In Andy Warhol Foundation v. Goldsmith, SCOTUS sides with the photographer, who says Warhol violated copyright by using her 1981 photo to create Prince artwork  —  - The Supreme Court ruled against the Andy Warhol Foundation in a copyright dispute over the use of a celebrity photographer's image of the musician Prince.

item.title: TikTokは、ユーザーがボタンをタップして楽曲を音楽アプリに追加できる音楽ストリーミングサービスとの統合をテスト中、今のところApple Musicが唯一の選択肢（Stuart Dredge/Music Ally)
item.description:
Stuart Dredge / Music Ally:
TikTok is testing an integration with music streaming services that lets users tap a button to add songs to a music app; so far, Apple Music is the only option  —  “Short-form video that doesn't lead anywhere is the most dangerous thing I've seen the music business face in a long time,” …

item.title: SCOTUS、ゴンザレス対グーグルの230条保護について言及せず、ツイッター対タームネーのテロ関連コンテンツに対する責任からツイッターを守る（Brian Fung/CNN)
item.description:
Brian Fung / CNN:
SCOTUS declines to address Section 230 protections in Gonzalez v. Google and shields Twitter from liability for terror-related content in Twitter v. Taamneh  —  Twitter will not have to face accusations it aided and abetted terrorism when it hosted tweets created by the terror group ISIS, the Supreme Court ruled Thursday.
